system.description:
This spell allows the caster to completely transform into another creature or object while retaining their own mind, hit points, and saving throws.

Transformation Details:

  • The caster gains the new formâ€™s Armor Class, attack rolls, special attack forms, immunities, and abilities.
  • The caster cannot cast spells unless in a bipedal humanoid form (demihuman, goblin, ogre, giant, etc.).
  • The caster cannot take the form of a specific individual, Elemental Ruler, or Immortal.
  • The caster cannot use spellbooks or scrolls in non-humanoid forms.
  • If the caster assumes another class's form, he does not gain that class's abilities.

Size Limitations:

  • The caster cannot assume huge inanimate forms.
  • The maximum size for an inanimate object is 1 foot per caster level and 100 cn per caster level.

Restrictions:

  • The caster may only change into creatures or objects that he has personally seen.
  • The caster cannot invent new creatures (e.g., a ten-armed troll unless they exist in the campaign).
  • The caster inherits the weaknesses of the chosen form (e.g., a dragon form is vulnerable to swords +2, +5 vs. dragons).
  • The caster may change form at will, but each transformation requires 1 full round of concentration.
  • The effect cannot be made permanent and is subject to dispel magic.
  • The caster cannot pass through protection from evil or anti-magic shell effects.
system.effect: Allows caster to change form completely
